title: Julian asks "Who's Afraid of Postmodernism?"
description:
Julian has read James KA Smith has a book by this title and wants to discuss it. He gives some brief chapter summaries and off we go! 

Notes
James KA Smith Who’s Afraid of Postmodernism
What is a metanarrative? 
“Not just a grand story but legitimate the story by an appeal to universal reason”
Through faith you live into the story. The role of faith in knowing
Derrida: there is nothing outside of the text
There is no seeing that isn’t interpretation
Always seeing the text through your lenses
There is no text without context
The necessity of the interpretive community
Shapes each other to see the world as Christians see it
The community makes you see in the narrative
You can’t see without interpretation
Foucault: power is knowledge
Knowledge and power are inextricably linked
Whenever there is a power system it will form people into their way of seeing the world
Gets at this through a long study of the prison system
JBP
Jesus as Christus Victor
Principalities and Powers
Protestant Reformation
Bible as a way of back to Christ instead of the church going forward
The end of Protestantism
Stanley Hauerwas
Hannah’s Child
For the audio podcast mirror on Podbean http://paulvanderklay.podbean.com/
